## Application.setState() method

Transition the application to a new state and emit an event

**Signature:**

```typescript
protected setState(state: string): void;
```

## Parameters

|  Parameter | Type | Description |
|  --- | --- | --- |
|  state | string | The new state |

**Returns:**

void
